newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - T-bonds must hold above 108-07 to push up.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - T-bonds must hold above 108-07 to push up.

text.p: U.S. T-bonds have the scope to move slightly higher on Wednesday, provided they can hold gains above key resistance around 108-07, technical analysts said.
"If we can sustain a break of that level it would help the market to target congestion at 108-30," said Elizabeth Miller, technical analyst at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell here.
But she added if the market cannot hold gains above 108-07, it may drift back to support at 107-16, then the 107-00 area.

Miller said said 108-07 was the 23.6 percent retracement of a slide on continuation charts from 114-08 on February 18 to 106-12 on April 11. It is also the point where the market has stalled in recent days.
Tom Hobson, director of technical analysis at Merril Lynch here, said the near term directional challenge was neutral to slightly positive.
"Within that environment significant resistance has remained intact and therefore it is the key challenge," he said. "Those resistance levels are 108-15 and 109-06, which is probably more critical."
Hobson said 108-15 was a 61.8 percent Fibonacci retracement of the selloff from the March 25 high and 109-06 was the 38.2 percent Fibonacci retracement of the whole two-month decline.
"Those are the key points and they need to be overcome by Friday, otherwise the short term directional risk will shift back to the downside," he said.
To the downside, Hobson said there was nothing significant until 107-18,16 level, which represents a chart consolidation support area.
"That is where the market bounced yesterday," he said.
"There is quite a positive bias today, but my overall bias remains negative," he said adding the recent decline in open interest indicated a more neutral trading environment.
June T-bonds at 1013 GMT were at 108-09, up 5/32.
